accessed.description: Last time the file was accessed. Note that not all filesystems keep track of access time.

attributes.description: Array of file attributes. Attributes names will vary by platform. Here's a non-exhaustive list of values that are expected in this field: archive, compressed, directory, encrypted, execute, hidden, read, readonly, system, write.

exists.description: Boolean to capture if a signature is present.

signing_id.description: The identifier used to sign the process. This is used to identify the application manufactured by a software vendor. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

status.description: Additional information about the certificate status. This is useful for logging cryptographic errors with the certificate validity or trust status. Leave unpopulated if the validity or trust of the certificate was unchecked.

subject_name.description: Subject name of the code signer

team_id.description: The team identifier used to sign the process. This is used to identify the team or vendor of a software product. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

trusted.description: Stores the trust status of the certificate chain. Validating the trust of the certificate chain may be complicated, and this field should only be populated by tools that actively check the status.

valid.description: Boolean to capture if the digital signature is verified against the binary content. Leave unpopulated if a certificate was unchecked.

created.description: File creation time. Note that not all filesystems store the creation time.

ctime.description: Last time the file attributes or metadata changed. Note that changes to the file content will update `mtime`. This implies `ctime` will be adjusted at the same time, since `mtime` is an attribute of the file.

device.description: Device that is the source of the file.

directory.description: Directory where the file is located. It should include the drive letter, when appropriate.

drive_letter.description: Drive letter where the file is located. This field is only relevant on Windows. The value should be uppercase, and not include the colon.

architecture.description: Machine architecture of the ELF file.

cpu_type.description: CPU type of the ELF file.

creation_date.description: Extracted when possible from the file's metadata. Indicates when it was built or compiled. It can also be faked by malware creators.

exports.description: List of exported element names and types.

abi_version.description: Version of the ELF Application Binary Interface (ABI).

class.description: Header class of the ELF file.

data.description: Data table of the ELF header.

entrypoint.description: Header entrypoint of the ELF file.

os_abi.description: Application Binary Interface (ABI) of the Linux OS.

type.description: Header type of the ELF file.

imports.description: List of imported element names and types.

sections.description: Section information of the ELF file.

chi2.description: Chi-square probability distribution of the section.

entropy.description: Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

shared_libraries.description: List of shared libraries used by this ELF object

telfhash.description: telfhash is symbol hash for ELF files, just like imphash is imports hash for PE files. Learn more at https://github.com/trendmicro/telfhash.

extension.description: File extension, excluding the leading dot. Note that when the file name has multiple extensions (example.tar.gz), only the last one should be captured ("gz", not "tar.gz").

gid.description: Primary group ID (GID) of the file.

group.description: Primary group name of the file.

inode.description: Inode representing the file in the filesystem.

mime_type.description: MIME type should identify the format of the file or stream of bytes using https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml[IANA official types], where possible. When more than one type is applicable, the most specific type should be used.

mode.description: Mode of the file in octal representation.

mtime.description: Last time the file content was modified.

name.description: Name of the file including the extension, without the directory.

path.description: Full path to the file, including the file name. It should include the drive letter, when appropriate.

architecture.description: CPU architecture target for the file.

company.description: Internal company name of the file, provided at compile-time.

compile_timestamp.description: Compile timestamp of the PE file.

creation_date.description: Extracted when possible from the file's metadata. Indicates when it was built or compiled. It can also be faked by malware creators.

debug.description: An array containing an object for each debug entry, if present. The expected fields for this nested object fall under the `debug.` prefix.

type.description: Information type generated by the debug options.

description.description: Internal description of the file, provided at compile-time.

entry_point.description: Relative byte offset to the base of the PE file.

exports.description: List of symbols exported by PE

file_version.description: Internal version of the file, provided at compile-time.

dhash.description: Difference Hash (dhash) to find files with a visually similar icon or thumbnail.

imphash.description: A hash of the imports in a PE file. An imphash -- or import hash -- can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values. Learn more at https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2014/01/tracking-malware-import-hashing.html.

machine_type.description: Machine type of the PE file.

original_file_name.description: Internal name of the file, provided at compile-time.

packers.description: List of packers and tools used.

product.description: Internal product name of the file, provided at compile-time.

resources.description: An array containing an object for each PE resource, if present. The expected fields for this nested object fall under the `resources.` prefix.

entropy.description: Measurement of entropy randomness in the resources section.

filetype.description: File type of the resources section.

md5.description: MD5 hash of the header for the PE file.

sections.description: Data about sections of compiled binary PE

entropy.description: Measurement of entropy randomness in the file.

raw_size.description: Size of the section or the dize of the initialized data on disk.

virtual_address.description: Virtual address available to the file.

size.description: File size in bytes. Only relevant when `file.type` is "file".

uid.description: The user ID (UID) or security identifier (SID) of the file owner.

alternative_names.description: List of subject alternative names (SAN). Name types vary by certificate authority and certificate type but commonly contain IP addresses, DNS names (and wildcards), and email addresses.

common_name.description: List of common name (CN) of issuing certificate authority.

distinguished_name.description: Distinguished name (DN) of issuing certificate authority.

organization.description: List of organizations (O) of issuing certificate authority.

organizational_unit.description: List of organizational units (OU) of issuing certificate authority.

state_or_province.description: List of state or province names (ST, S, or P)

not_after.description: Time at which the certificate is no longer considered valid.

not_before.description: Time at which the certificate is first considered valid.

public_key_algorithm.description: Algorithm used to generate the public key.

public_key_curve.description: The curve used by the elliptic curve public key algorithm. This is algorithm specific.

public_key_exponent.description: Exponent used to derive the public key. This is algorithm specific.

public_key_size.description: The size of the public key space in bits.

serial_number.description: Unique serial number issued by the certificate authority. For consistency, if this value is alphanumeric, it should be formatted without colons and uppercase characters.

signature_algorithm.description: Identifier for certificate signature algorithm. We recommend using names found in Go Lang Crypto library. See https://github.com/golang/go/blob/go1.14/src/crypto/x509/x509.go#L337-L353.

common_name.description: List of common names (CN) of subject.

distinguished_name.description: Distinguished name (DN) of the certificate subject entity.

organizational_unit.description: List of organizational units (OU) of subject.

state_or_province.description: List of state or province names (ST, S, or P)
